answers.answer: MS can certainly cause vague neurological symptoms that come and go as can anxiety.  As I have never seen your MRI, I cannot accurately comment on as to whether or not this supports or refutes the diagnosis of MS.  However, if they're nonspecific and just scattered throughout the white matter, they may just be incidnetal findings that represent migraine changes, incidental findigns or chagnes related to stroke risk factors such as high blood pressure and diabetes.  A positive ANA also doesn't necessarily mean anything unless there's a significant elevation in the titer or absolute value by other testing methods.  The second opinion should be helpful - make sure you bring your films. In the meantime, if you do have significant anxiety, consider medications or counseling to see if this reduces your symptoms.  Good luck.

question: I HAVE A POSS MS DX.   I HAD AN ABNORMAL MRI WITH 4 LESIONS.NORMAL VER AND BAER--NORMAL SPINAL TAP.  ANA POSITIVE AND PROTEIN HIGH.  MY SYMPTOMS STARTED OUT WITH NUMBESS, TINGLING BURNING ON LEFT SIDE.  NOW IT'S IN BOTH LEGS--BUT IT MAY LAST ONLY A FEW HOURS AND THEN RESOLVE.  IS THIS NORMAL IN MS?I HAVE A 2ND OPINION APPT IN JULY.  YESTERDAY I WOKE UP DIZZY THEN I STARTED TO BURN AND TINGLE ALL OVER.  THIS LASTED ABOUT 3 HOURS.  TODAY MY LEGS ARE STILL WEAK AND COLD.  COULD THIS BE ANIXETY INSTEAD OF MS?
title: dizzy/numbness/burning
